text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to refer to the concept of investor obligations (investors may bear duties correlating with their protected rights). While the response extensively discusses the host state's counterclaim based on the investor's alleged violation of domestic environmental law (which implies an investor obligation), it never explicitly frames this as 'investor obligations' or discusses the general concept that protected rights correlate with duties. It focuses purely on the admissibility of the state's counterclaim based on the investor's alleged breach of domestic law, rather than the underlying principle of correlative obligations.", "criterion_id": "8e67c865-88cc-450f-8f76-dbbc48981395"}
